website_summaries.verdict: Two huge Super Mario games in one is an excellent value, and tackling all of these obstacle-packed levels with friends and family will keep players coming back for more.
pros: Includes both New Super Mario Bros. U and New Super Luigi U
Nearly-invincible Nabbit character is perfect for young players
cons: New Super Luigi U is a more challenging adventure, as you start each level with only 100 seconds on the clock

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled to think you’re getting a brand new game with new content , if you played this game on the wiiu you aren’t missing much . Few changes and couple new characters is really all you’re getting . With that said the game is fun but it’s not a new game .
customer_reviews.author: Z Swaidan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if it’s your first time!
customer_reviews.text: I never placed this on Wii U so it is all new to me. It’s a great throw back to super Mario brothers 3. Graphics are better and the story is as you’d expect. It is a great deal of fun and you can play it with your kids. So for me it is well worth the money. If you owned the old version on the Wii U there are several new things and upgrades but I don’t know if I’d spend another $60 for them.
customer_reviews.author: officer

customer_reviews.title: Fun game but I don't recommend if you suck at video games
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game but I can only play it for about a half hour before I'm screaming and throwing the remote. My boyfriend never played Mario (I know) and introduced himself by starting out with this game and shortly after I could hear him screaming in frustration from across the house. Some people just are not meant to play Mario.
customer_reviews.author: megbubbster

customer_reviews.title: Just like old times.
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome reminds me of the ones I played as a kid 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: John Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing New, Not Creative
customer_reviews.text: The game is boring, nothing new or creative about it from previous Mario’s. My family and I are disappointed by it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Negron

customer_reviews.title: Best Super Mario Bros game to date!
customer_reviews.text: This game is lots of fun if you’re into Super Mario Bros but want a nice visual enhancement. If you’re like me and never owned a Wii U as this was originally on the Wii U then definitely pick this up. You can do co-op with friends and family if you have extra joycons as there are multiple characters to choose from including Luigi, Nabbit, And Toadette. It also includes the other version of the game New Super Luigi U. Definitely worth a buy if you’re into this style of 2D game and haven’t played before!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It’s fun, played it for the Wii U and now Switch. It’s not a life changer, but great classic MARIO game play.
customer_reviews.author: book

customer_reviews.title: Love this Game
customer_reviews.text: I love Super Mario Games in general but this one is pretty fun. I like that you can choose the difficulty and on the easier setting if you get stuck on a level you can choose for Luigi to pass it for you. I am by no means a professional gamer but I bought a switch just so I could play Mario games and this is y far my favorite. Very similar to Classic Mario with an update.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loving the addition of the baby yoshi's. My daughter just can't put it down. Great family game!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Graphics Are Gorgeous!
customer_reviews.text: Even though this title was previously available on the Wii U the graphics are gorgeous on the switch. I have used my switch mostly in the dock mode but found myself taking it off the dock and playing on the go. I appreciate the different difficulty levels as I am not a hard core gamer but still enjoy playing. Definitely worth the coins!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Or Ronda Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome side scroller. Best since Super Mario 3
customer_reviews.text: I have played all versions of Mario. I loved Odyssey for Switch- and thought it would be difficult to return to a side scroller that was captivating. This game proves otherwise. Great playability, where you can play for 10 minutes or 2 hours. It’s makes it a perfect casual play for group of 1 to 4. Love it
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Car Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fun game with a minor glitch
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old and I love this game. He plays on his own and at times we play together. The glitch in the game however, is that when 1 player dies, the game screen literally pauses when the other player is in the middle of playing. This is an issue when you are trying to not die from jumping over something. We still love it though!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: We ha e waited a long time!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the switch in antisipation of those games release. Love that 4 players can play. The game works well and no complains. We have a wireless controller which is easier for my giant hands than the stock ones. Hoping that mario maker is released so I can build fun levels that challenge my family.
customer_reviews.author: ALWood

customer_reviews.title: Worst save feature in a modern game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun Mario game, but what was Nintendo thinking by limiting saves to boss levels only? No matter how many levels you pass, your progress will disappear unless you go to a castle and defeat the boss. Your only other option is to do a “quick save” and not close the app. It turns a fun game into a grind, sometimes I only have time for one quick level. Then I have to go to a castle and run through the entire thing to save my progress. Annoying feature that shouldn’t be in a modern game. Great game, just be ready to backtrack a lot, in order to save.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: NO GAME CARTRIDGE IN BOX
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my son's 7th birthday. I bought it early and when I received the package I removed the game and hid it. We woke up on his birthday and I gave it to him before he went to school and when he removed the plastic and opened the box there was NO game cartridge on the box. Naturally my son started crying. He was so excited to get this game since he'd been asking for it since he got his switch. So much for that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Switch Super Mario Bros.U deluxe.
customer_reviews.text: Mario games come in all shapes and sizes. Rereleased on Switch as New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe, the game now includes its large and challenging expansion, New Super Luigi U, and a handful of tweaks and additions, like you don't have to be Mario if you're player one. New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe may not be everyone’s No.1 Mario game of all time, but I guarantee it will remind every fan of what makes their favorite special.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Alvarisi

customer_reviews.title: WTF
customer_reviews.text: The case was empty. They wrapped it in plastic and there was nothing inside but the case. Returning it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mesha

customer_reviews.title: Box arrived empty, without the game.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a birthday gift for my son and when he opened the box it was EMPTY! Such a disappointment. Update: I sent he product back 2 weeks ago, and it still says the product is in transit. Terrible experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: Molt_llest

customer_reviews.title: The package came empty
customer_reviews.text: I got home from work and wanted to play my new game. I went to go open the package and it felt very light. It was sealed but it was empty. No game.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Harper

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If there was less than a star that is what I would give. I bought this game and all that arrived was the case. Very disappointing. I was so looking forward to playing it the day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Archangel1130

customer_reviews.title: Game Case Empty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew and when he opened it the case was empty. We were able to return it and get a refund. I ended up buying the game at a brick and mortar retail store. I'm sure this was a fluke, but wanted others to be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth l. schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Classic family fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this game!!! This is the best Mario game in many years. If you like the original Mario brothers 3 and Super Mario World then this is THE game for you. Classic characters (and new ones) and map style mixed with the updated graphics and challenging levels. The 3 player and 4 player mode is challenging but loads of fun when you all work as a team. Great game for all ages!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Maguigan

customer_reviews.title: Super fun with family and friends
customer_reviews.text: Tried this at a friend's house - first time playing the New Super Mario Bros Deluxe edition on the Switch so I have no prior experience with the Wii version. Had a complete blast even though we aren't super great at the game - Toadette and Nabbit being the super easy characters with perks. Definitely a recommended platformer for co-op on the couch up to four friends - feel free to gang up on the weakest link, but make sure they bubble (both L + R top bumper buttons) to you.
customer_reviews.author: Hiryuu

customer_reviews.title: Fun game with friends, short story
customer_reviews.text: The game is great to play with friends, reminds me of Super Mario Bros. Wii. Although Nabit as a new character is basically playing in ultra cheat mode... he doesn't die from hitting enemies, with him on your team you will always beat the bosses... The main story line was very short, but that might have been because one of my friends was using Nabit the whole time. The only annoying thing I found was that you could only save after beating a boss stage, if you quit right before beating it, you would have to start back from the last boss save point. It is still a fun group game though.
customer_reviews.author: Squishy

customer_reviews.title: Other than a bump in graphics, nothing new
customer_reviews.text: If you're invested in the Mario ecosystem and have outgrown every Nintendo console prior to the Switch, you'll find yourself purchasing this version, too. Luckily, there is a little something more to look forward to than just the ability to play on the Switch - the graphics got a bump and Mario and friends look better than ever. But that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: robk64

customer_reviews.title: RIP off! Received a piece of foam instead of the game cartridge.
customer_reviews.text: This was a rip off. Instead of a game cartridge inside the case we received a piece of black foam. This needs to be made right.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Classic Mario Bros. Feel and Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Context: I bought a Switch for my daughter for Christmas because some of my favorite memories as a child are playing games with my parents and siblings. Summary: This game is so much fun. Equal parts 'Frustrating', 'Skill', and 'Patience'. I can't recommend this game enough for old-timer SNES players (I am 33 haha), or anyone looking to have a fun time in the world of Mario. At 33 years old, this game is just as fun as the original I played when I was 6 years old. There are few games, systems, or entertainment devices that transcend age and time. These games are one of them. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: I did not recive the game at all, it was completely empty.
customer_reviews.author: maria lynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazeball
customer_reviews.text: As a kid I played Mario 3 and remembered thinking how far they'd come since the original! This is a throw back to the simple times of 2D -- and it does it right. Stunning graphics and smooth gameplay. Some levels are actually hard enough that I have to die a few times -- that never happens anymore! Playing with a partner brings joy and anger too! They help you cross a platform, only to knock you off the next! Love and hate!
customer_reviews.author: Medstud99

customer_reviews.title: a reminder why nintendo is great
customer_reviews.text: 2D super Mario games are super fun to play always. This is no exception. easy to pick up for anyone youll find challenging levels in some parts. yes its almost the same game as the wii u version. I enjoy it replaying it years later. Plus i had digital version on wii u and now i have the physical on switch. No regret with purchase. This is a must own for switch owners unless your content with the wii u version. As you arent getting much more.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Good wholesome family fun!
customer_reviews.text: The whole family loves to play this game. It’s super annoying when your 8 year old knocks you off a cliff or into lava, but we have a good time playing as a family. This game will teach you patience when you play with children. The power ups are mostly like the old Wii version, but with a few new twists. We like it. Warning! Some levels are impossible to beat with toddlers in tow.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but it's just like the Wii-U version.
customer_reviews.text: If you have not already bought this game for the Wii-U then it is a must have for any Mario Bros. fan. The game is fun and contains several hours of levels and bonuses. I cannot express how FUN the game really is. But, if you have it already for the Wii-U, it's the same exact game...only now you can be Toadette. That's it. That's what you pay another $60 for. To recap: First time purchasers - Totally Worth it! Wii-U owners: Not that different what you probably already have.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This game rocked on the Wii-U and it still rocks on the Switch
customer_reviews.text: There's been some hate toward this release given that it doesn't really bring anything new to the table, but personally, I don't mind because I loved this game on the Wii-U and it's been a long time since I played it. Going back through the whole game again didn't feel like repetition at all. Also, having it on the Switch just made it all the more enjoyable due to its mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hann

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I love Mario games I’m 30 and grew up playing these games but it frustrates me sometimes as I cannot pass the levels lol. To my small nephews it’s easy but idk maybe I’m just getting rusty 😒
customer_reviews.author: veronica

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special
customer_reviews.text: Back when the Wii was HUGE we purchased the Red one that had New Super Mario Bros. bundled with it. It was great! That said, this really just seems like the same old game with updated visuals. There's nothing too spectacular about it, but it's a great game to have in the collection and an excellent thing to do with a few friends.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin's Beard

customer_reviews.title: A Return to Classic Super Mario
customer_reviews.text: I've only scratched the surface of this vast new game. I was very glad to see a return of the more classic Super Mario games where the action is pretty much a linear scroll to the right, unlike Super Mario Odyssey, which to me is more like the later Zelda games where you even collect items to use. There's nothing inherently wrong with that way, but I like my Super Mario to be like this new game. This one is big. I'll be at it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K

customer_reviews.title: How Many Times Have I Bought This Now?
customer_reviews.text: It's a great game, so if you missed out on playing it when it was just for the Wii U, buy this to play on the Switch and experience this stellar platformer for the first time! Or, if you're like me and already owned it on the Wii U, buy it again! It's even better on the Switch, and playing it on the big screen looks amazing. The small additions in this deluxe version make it worth playing again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Bought New Arrived Used
customer_reviews.text: Was sold a previously used item. Game case was shrink wrapped like normal. Went to play and 3 files with different progression were played. Dont really care as everything seemed functional. But want to alert others so maybe Amazon can start having better quality control on this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: livtothefullest

customer_reviews.title: Every Nintendo console needs a 2D Mario
customer_reviews.text: Although this game should not cost more than the Wii U version, as it's been out for a long time now, I do still think this is a great Switch game to have. 2D Mario games are great when you're on roadtrips or just travelling in general. They quick, simple, and fun. This game offers modes to those of every skill level, which is very nice. It even offers Super Luigi U, which I think it basically for those who want an extra challenge. There's not much to say. You can't go wrong with these games.
customer_reviews.author: anthony derrenberger

customer_reviews.title: Bye game
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great game. Older child was chasing the younger child for the video game (while they were supposed to be doing their virtual learning-insert crazy mom emoji). Small child tossed tiny video game into trash can and it could not be found anywhere-even after multiple complete emptying of trash by parents. Sigh...
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Fake. Don't buy. Got a piece of foam
customer_reviews.text: Got a nice little piece of black foam instead of the game 😡
customer_reviews.author: NickiB

customer_reviews.title: Wii u repeat
customer_reviews.text: It's basically a repeat of the Wii u Super Mario 3d with only slight differences but the basic switch controls make it easy to accediently knock the wrong button causing game to pause the x box style controls wireless are expensive but this game can be aggravating with the normal switch remotes but it's a fun game with right remotes and if you haven't already played the slightly better wii u version of it
customer_reviews.author: LMR

customer_reviews.title: No game inside
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this item and there is no game inside the box. It is empty. Very disappointed about this. I have been charged for a case with no game inside. I am returning the empty box via Ups.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Arbulu

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about this game is that the entirety of the main story is playable with two players at exactly the same difficulty as if it were a one-player game. You can also change the ease of your characters -- Toadette and Rabbid are easier than Luigi and Mario, for example -- to customize your playing experience. The colors and detailing on this game are also excellent. In short, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great game to definitely try out!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game that's great for multiplayer. The graphics are amazing, the new mechanics are fun, and it's great that they added old items back in. There are many other multiplayer modes other than the basic story line to keep you entertained. When you're done with Super Mario Bros you can go right over and play Super Luigi U because they're both included. Definitely worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play with my kids! Brings me back to my childhood of playing Mario brothers on the old school Nintendo! My kids love playing this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is Mario. What more needs to be said?
customer_reviews.text: It's 2D Mario (and Luigi). While the formula is essentially the same over 35 years, still an excellent version. We have it on Wii U AND Switch because of the addition of Nabbit and Toadette. My wife really likes Peachette and Nabbit is great for young kids.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun game, good for adults and kids, reminds me of super mario world from super Nintendo. great game, would totally recommend
customer_reviews.author: aya

customer_reviews.title: Another fun Super Mario Bros. game!
customer_reviews.text: I always enjoy NSMB games. Not too hard, not too easy, plenty to do, and offers multiplayer. I love how it’s two games for the price of one too! Both are very fun to play. I would recommend this if you own a Switch or enjoy platforming games.
customer_reviews.author: FamiLee

customer_reviews.title: Great couch co-op game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and I to play a few levels every night. We are both completionists, so we will replay the level until we collect everything. We didn't finish our Wii U version, so I am glad they re-released this, but decided to include the Luigi edition with it. Can't wait to beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Love love love mario
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this game when it came out on the Wii U but this one is much better! There is a new character you can play and supposedly more levels. I have always been a huge fan of Mario games preferably the ones that side scroll. I hope Nintendo keeps it up!
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: Same but totally different
customer_reviews.text: Love this mario games they never disappoint any of their followers and this is and improve version with new characters that change the way we play it
customer_reviews.author: THE GILZ

customer_reviews.title: Great family game, good for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We love playing this at our house. My 3 year old plays as Nabbit and my 7 year old plays as Toadette and it works out well for us. My 7 year old actually beat the game by herself on her profile, mostly using Nabbit but she got braver and started using Toadette towards the end. Definitely a fun game for family game night
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: Great family game. Easy enough for young kids and play and entertaining enough for adults. If a kid looses enough times on a level, the game does a walkthrough of it and lets them skip over it. Endless continues make it so you never loose all of your progress.
customer_reviews.author: saxist

customer_reviews.title: Caused tension with the wife..
customer_reviews.text: I was bored with is one pretty fast, but then again maybe I kind of out grown it. My wife isn’t really good with video games and after she caused me to die several times I Had to quit for the sake of the marriage...
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game... Keeps my brain busy... now i need to get the steering wheels... anybody want to give me a gift 🎁... wink wink wink... I love Nintendo Switch... Don’t want to share with kids...
customer_reviews.author: MyZtiX WenZ

customer_reviews.title: Mario fan
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Mario fan so I preordered this game and I am not dissapointed! I did not have a WiiU prior to a Nintendo Switch so I so I not know what the Super Bros game was like on that system but I have heard that some maps are similar. I found each level fun and exciting. The only part that I have yet to conquer is the star bonus one. It's really challenging. Overall I love the product and that I was able to pre-order and how quickly it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A game for the family. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent side scrolling fun with classic Mario characters! Despite the negative criticism of others, I got this game for play with my family. To my relief this game is tons of fun with many players on the same screen, and reminds me of the old days of one screen multiplayers. Great fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: NCaste45

customer_reviews.title: 99% identical to the Wii version
customer_reviews.text: This game is 99% identical to the Wii version. Waste of money if you've already completed the Wii version.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Updated Mario game
customer_reviews.text: This is the typical format for Mario at least since SuperMarioWorld on SNES. Go through different worlds and play different levels. Move back and forth at will, skip some stuff etc. Its a fun game with some new and fun suits as well as new twists on Yoshi.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Not bad of a game
customer_reviews.text: It’s not bad of a game for Mario fans but again it can get a bit boring after a while. Most of the gameplay is depended on you to to keep repeating the stages after loosing your lives.
customer_reviews.author: ScenTyle

customer_reviews.title: Fun, not too challenging
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my roommate and he enjoyed it. I asked him why he gave it 4 stars instead of 5 and he said it's too easy. He 100% completed it with all of the secret exits and star coins in every level. He's in his mid-30s and has a PhD so take it with a grain of salt about it being 'too easy'. Regardless, it'll probably be an enjoyable addition to your Switch game collection.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: So We actually purchased this game based on the fact that we had the older version for nintendo wii and man we were really addicted to it back then. Well we really enjoy it for the switch as well. Better graphics and more characters to choose from. We have only had it for a day though so we will update once we keep using.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmin Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Get Super Mario Maker 2 instead
customer_reviews.text: I played NSMBU on Wii U and despite hearing it was not worthing buy the game if you had already played I want another Mario game to play, so I bought it. The game is not bad but now that I am playing it again I see how stale the "new" 2D Mario games can be. At this point even if you've never played the game on Wii U, I would wait and save your money for Super Mario Maker 2 (it comes out in June 2019).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Itsa Me!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my children for Eid along with the Switch. Great game and gaming system so far. Even found myself playing it. This is a long game with many different characters and levels. Great for occupying time. Gave it four stars because it didn’t come with an instruction booklet.
customer_reviews.author: Major

customer_reviews.title: Old school Mario on a new school device
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to play a "next-gen" mario type game on my Switch. There are tons of levels in this game, can be very tricky and hard but great fun game overall.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well-balanced game
customer_reviews.text: I played with my wife quite a bit. Overall the game are well balanced between being a little challenging to have fun, and being easy enough for those who don’t play games a lot particularly if you use two easiest characters.
customer_reviews.author: yixinyiyi

customer_reviews.title: Not a new game
customer_reviews.text: As the title suggests, this is a direct port over (copy) of the Wii U version of Mario. If you have beaten the Wii U Mario you have beaten this exact game already. Only difference is two additional playable characters (Nabbit and Princess) which allow you to play in sort of an "easy" mode.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old has had this game about a week and is obsessed lol. Easy enough for him to play solo but also challenging for an adult. Great game for the switch!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It gets harder with more people
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. It's Mario that allows 4 players. I tried playing with my 6 and 4 year old and it's too challenging when you add more people as you run into each other and can kill each other by leaving someone behind.
customer_reviews.author: Machido

customer_reviews.title: Only for ONE PLAYER!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY “Animal Crossing - New Horizions” for the Nintendo Switch if you have more than one child ! ! ! This game is NOT player friendly if there is more than one child. It has been a fight to the death since the day we bought it ! ! ! Everyone lives on the same island & they all have to share items. It is not conducive to positive family relationships!
customer_reviews.author: Julian C Phares

customer_reviews.title: No game cartridge in box
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I'm not the only one. Bought as a present for my 8 year old son. It looked new to me. The plastic covering was intact. I gift wrapped it. When he opened it, there was no game cartridge inside. I was surprised to see how many other Switch owners it's happened to & not just for this game. This will be the last cartridge we buy online for the switch. It's all DLC from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tingiris

customer_reviews.title: Love it It’s a cut between old type and new type game.
customer_reviews.text: I love the integration they have with both platforms, super fun to play, a must get if you are a Mario fan. I also gave one as a gift and that person loves it as well ;)
customer_reviews.author: Keith Machisen

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic moment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for my mate and she absolutely loves it! She has yet to put it down. This has filled her nostalgia for old school games 🎮 Delivery time was great.
customer_reviews.author: ChaunJay

customer_reviews.title: Fun for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could play with my son. I'm not used to games that allow players to play at the same time. I'm more of an old school gamer but I quickly got the hang of this. It's fun and not too complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Renee F

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging and nostalgic .
customer_reviews.text: So much fun for my whole family. Even my 2 year old gets in on the action. I got it because I am a fan of The Super MARIO Brothers and more importantly it is my kids’ first video game. This game brought back so many memories growing up in the early 90s, it safe to say I also bought this for nostalgic reasons.

product_meta.title: New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description:
Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:Standard

Join Mario, Luigi, and pals for single-player or multiplayer fun anytime, anywhere! Take on two family-friendly, side-scrolling adventures with up to three friends* as you try to save the Mushroom Kingdom. Includes the New Super Mario Bros. U and harder, faster New Super Luigi U games—both of which include Nabbit and Toadette as playable characters!

Two games in one, for double the fun! Simple, straightforward controls, new playable characters optimized for younger and less-experienced players, and a wealth of bonus content—like a Hints gallery and helpful reference videos**—make this a perfect choice for anyone looking to introduce their family to the wonderful world of Mario. All a player needs is one Joy-Con controller, so two people can team up right out of the box! Tackle 164 platforming courses in the two main game modes and enjoy extra replayability with three additional game modes in which you can also play as a Mii character: Challenges, Boost Rush, and Coin Battle!

*Additional accessories may be required for multiplayer mode. Sold separately.
**Internet access required in order to access Videos gallery
feature_bullets: A variety of playable characters are available, some with unique attributes that affect gameplay and platforming physics.

Younger and less-experienced players will love playing as Toadette, who is brand new to both games, and Nabbit, who was formerly only playable in New Super Luigi U. Both characters offer extra assistance during play.
Multiplayer sessions are even more fun, frantic, and exciting thanks to entertaining character interactions. Need a boost? Try jumping off a teammate’s head or getting a teammate to throw you!
Features a wealth of help features, like a Hints gallery, reference videos**, and a Super Guide in New Super Mario Bros. U that can complete levels for you if they’re giving you trouble.

Three additional modes—Boost Rush, Challenges, and Coin Battle—mix up gameplay and add replayability, while also upping the difficulty for players who want to try something harder. Players can use their Mii characters in these modes!
